body: Thank you for opening the issue, those checkers should indeed be almost instantaneous.
FYI: in the same pr I did tests for other mentioned checkers (normally they should finish in 10-15 min on the Github Actions CI).

I did more tests.  It seems, `pylint --ignore-patterns=test_ode.py diofant` - pass.  See [these](https://github.com/diofant/diofant/actions/runs/1816890580) jobs (with [that diff](https://github.com/diofant/diofant/pull/1205/commits/1c710dea9f1b928cf151ee3cbd5698645316d174)).

The matched [test_ode.py](https://github.com/diofant/diofant/blob/6e280e9d0c974a239f850b95e0162f1dd209da20/diofant/tests/solvers/test_ode.py) has very long lines (up to 5699; ~50 lines with more 1000 symbols).

I don't know how this (and related) checker works, but if it uses regrexps I would guess that the issue might be related with the catastrophic backtracking.

I ran a quick and dirty profile on the linting of that specific file. If you look at the profile it might not actually be the final new line:
```console
         77898208 function calls (58290819 primitive calls) in 46.514 seconds
   Ordered by: cumulative time
   ncalls  tottime  percall  cumtime  percall filename:lineno(function)
    417/1    0.007    0.000   46.534   46.534 {built-in method builtins.exec}
        1    0.000    0.000   46.533   46.533 runpy.py:199(run_module)
        1    0.000    0.000   46.532   46.532 runpy.py:63(_run_code)
        1    0.000    0.000   46.532   46.532 __main__.py:1(<module>)
        1    0.000    0.000   46.532   46.532 __init__.py:21(run_pylint)
        1    0.000    0.000   45.650   45.650 run.py:76(__init__)
        1    0.000    0.000   45.392   45.392 pylinter.py:1042(check)
        1    0.000    0.000   45.392   45.392 pylinter.py:1101(_check_files)
        1    0.000    0.000   45.378   45.378 pylinter.py:1123(_check_file)
        1    0.007    0.007   42.349   42.349 pylinter.py:1290(check_astroid_module)
        1    0.000    0.000   42.342   42.342 pylinter.py:1307(_check_astroid_module
  46869/1    0.345    0.000   38.345   38.345 ast_walker.py:54(walk)
275582/35596    0.112    0.000   22.190    0.001 {built-in method builtins.next}
488073/71544    0.999    0.000   22.178    0.000 node_ng.py:121(infer)
266666/51105    0.444    0.000   22.026    0.000 decorators.py:101(wrapped)
301300/57460    0.215    0.000   21.972    0.000 decorators.py:138(raise_if_nothing_
217596/95463    0.364    0.000   19.292    0.000 bases.py:140(_infer_stmts)
    94/49    0.003    0.000   18.725    0.382 manager.py:103(ast_from_file)
    94/49    0.047    0.001   18.722    0.382 builder.py:115(file_build)
39855/23061    0.111    0.000   17.507    0.001 inference.py:232(infer_call)
26926/25288    0.043    0.000   15.991    0.001 scoped_nodes.py:676(import_module)
26933/25288    0.020    0.000   15.758    0.001 manager.py:157(ast_from_module_name)
26794/25383    0.088    0.000   14.346    0.001 inference.py:279(infer_import_from)
26874/25360    0.063    0.000   13.932    0.001 mixins.py:92(do_import_module)
      196    0.002    0.000   12.978    0.066 builder.py:178(_data_build)
      196    0.002    0.000   11.711    0.060 rebuilder.py:136(visit_module)
      196    0.002    0.000   11.707    0.060 rebuilder.py:152(<listcomp>)
286849/3171    0.268    0.000   11.705    0.004 rebuilder.py:488(visit)
4682/4408    0.043    0.000   11.322    0.003 rebuilder.py:1503(_visit_functiondef)
4659/4388    0.005    0.000   11.312    0.003 rebuilder.py:1558(visit_functiondef)
   196/51    0.002    0.000   10.605    0.208 builder.py:159(_post_build)
    10430    0.035    0.000   10.592    0.001 utils.py:1241(safe_infer)
4682/4408    0.008    0.000   10.354    0.002 rebuilder.py:1549(<listcomp>)
14945/14178    0.040    0.000   10.278    0.001 inference.py:947(infer_assign)
   153462    0.674    0.000    9.685    0.000 decorators.py:171(wrapper)
27914/19542    0.061    0.000    9.257    0.000 scoped_nodes.py:1871(infer_call_resu
     7957    0.138    0.000    9.206    0.001 typecheck.py:1332(visit_call)
7154/5982    0.011    0.000    8.757    0.001 inference.py:311(infer_attribute)
14542376/786850    6.842    0.000    8.736    0.000 node_ng.py:527(nodes_of_class)
   153475    0.106    0.000    8.536    0.000 inspect.py:3243(signature)
   153475    0.115    0.000    8.430    0.000 inspect.py:2989(from_callable)
153476/153475    0.928    0.000    8.315    0.000 inspect.py:2369(_signature_from_ca
     7957    0.033    0.000    8.112    0.001 refactoring_checker.py:996(visit_call)
     8244    0.221    0.000    8.080    0.001 typecheck.py:666(_no_context_variadic)
```
`nodes_of_class` which is being called by `_no_context_variadic` is taking a considerable amount of time. That might be the culprit here.

![out](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13665637/153295329-6fd1a423-a2cd-4a4b-bd69-3b81290cfe5c.svg)

> it might not actually be the final new line

Well, my point is that the problem is triggered by the 'missing-final-newline' checker (or other mentioned above checkers).  If [remove](https://github.com/diofant/diofant/pull/1205/commits/50ec46a5c27128f129364de1ad88f3de5ae298c6) these lines, `pylint diofant` doesn't timeout on CI.

My bad, I forgot you `missing-finale-newline` is disabled by default (although the other issue is also quite interesting performance-wise).

For those looking to tackle this issue. The issue is with this `re.search` call:
https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/blob/851b63e897fdcdb07b939ac7873e9ea3a94f1115/pylint/checkers/format.py#L778

We get stuck here on the file @skirpichev mentioned.

The pattern is:
https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/blob/851b63e897fdcdb07b939ac7873e9ea3a94f1115/pylint/utils/pragma_parser.py#L11-L23

issue.title: Fix parsing of long lines when ``missing-final-newline`` is enabled

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
- [x] Add yourself to CONTRIBUTORS if you are a new contributor.
- [x] Add a ChangeLog entry describing what your PR does.
- [x] If it's a new feature, or an important bug fix, add a What's New entry in
      `doc/whatsnew/<current release.rst>`.
- [x] Write a good description on what the PR does.

## Type of Changes

|     | Type                   |
| --- | ---------------------- |
| âœ“   | :bug: Bug fix          |

## Description

Closes #5724.

The stuff at the beginning of this regex pattern isn't actually needed for us to extract our disable comments. This massively speeds up the parsing and unstucks us from the code in the issue.
I haven't added a test case as it is a bit difficult to test "don't look for things we don't need"...

body: Submitted a PR as the fix proved to be very easy. ðŸ˜„
Oh, I think my guess was correct.  The nested construct with catastrophic backtracking seems to be the problem.

issue.title: Optimize handling of long lines for checkers like 'missing-final-newline'

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:

| âœ“   | :bug: Bug fix          |


## Description

<!--
If this PR fixes a particular issue, use the following to automatically close that issue
once this PR gets merged:
-->

A replacement for #5786 per suggestion of @DanielNoord.  Fix catastrophic backtracking in OPTION_RGX.

Closes #5724
